title: Point of View Quiz
description: Test your understanding of narrative perspectives, from first person to omniscient third person

questions.question: Which point of view uses pronouns like 'I,' 'me,' and 'my'?
Which point of view uses 'you' to address the reader directly?
In third person omniscient, the narrator:
options: Knows the thoughts and feelings of all characters
Is a character in the story
Speaks directly to the reader using 'you'
Only knows the thoughts of one character

questions.question: In third person limited, the narrator:
options: Has access to the thoughts and feelings of only one character
Is a character telling their own story

questions.question: 'I walked into the room and immediately sensed something was wrong.' This is written in which point of view?
'You open the door and step inside.' This is written in which point of view?
Which classic novel is written in first person by its narrator, Nick Carraway?
What is a 'third person objective' narrator?
options: A narrator who speaks in second person
A narrator who reports only what can be observed externally, without revealing any character's thoughts
A narrator who shares every character's thoughts
A narrator who is biased toward the protagonist

questions.question: What is 'multiple points of view' or 'alternating perspective'?
options: A story that never reveals any character's thoughts
A story told by one narrator who is always right
A story that switches between different characters' perspectives across chapters or sections
A story told entirely in dialogue

questions.question: Why might an author choose to use an unreliable first-person narrator?
options: To create suspense and make the reader question what is true
Because first person is easier to write

questions.question: 'She thought about her childhood as she gazed out the window.' If only her thoughts are shared throughout the book, this is:
The 'Choose Your Own Adventure' book series famously uses which point of view?
Leo Tolstoy's 'War and Peace' is told by a narrator who knows the thoughts and motivations of many characters. This is:
What advantage does first-person narration provide?
options: The reader experiences an intimate, personal connection with the narrator
The reader knows everything that happens in the story
Multiple storylines can be followed simultaneously
The story is always completely objective

questions.question: What is 'free indirect discourse'?
options: A technique blending third-person narration with a character's internal voice and thoughts
A story told by an animal character
